column10: MSG
b"b' Fix alignment traps on ARMv7'"

b"b' Access doubles via a packed struct so the generated code works withunaligned pointers too. The code generated by gcc for i386 and amd64for such an access is identical to the code generated by a directreference. I tried making the patch as clean as possible but some of the expressions got quite elaborate here. So you can take it as an RFC for fixing the last bits of ARM support :)'"
b"b' Can you switch the C style casts to C++ style?  Just for the lines you modified; you can leave the others.'"
b"b' Right
column11: I just used the same types of casts as were there before. Nested reinterpreted casts statements will look quite weird :)'"

column10: b'b" Sorry
column11: this patch breaks multi-line editing in the shell.  See SERVER-5764
column12: which was resolved by rolling this change back. The shell line processing logic is unfortunately more spaghetti than I realized
column13: and of course there\'s no document specifying expected behavior for these cases. Anyhow
column14: if you want to dig further and see how to preserve multi-line editing in the face of this
column15: the whole input processing module is fair game for reexamination.  I don\'t know what your interest level is
column16: but I can try to get someone over here to draft a spec for how they think shell input is supposed to work."'

b"b' SERVER-12034 Fix bug with SIGXCPU causing a core dump in '"
b"b' Log and gracefully shutdown on signal SIGXCPU.'"
b'b\' This looks good to me
column11: but I want to get another pair of eyes on it. @andy10gen ? "man 7 signal" on my Ubuntu box shows:  \''

column10: b'b" What\'s the harm to possibly taking a long time?  Clean shutdown can take seconds."'
b'b" SIGXCPU is generated every second the process attempts to use more of a CPUslice then it is allowed
column11: as such there shouldn\'t be any harm in gracefullyshutting down.  In my mind the flip side argument here is to log it andkeep running.  However
column12: if you have under provisioned
column13: having it appear inyour face seems reasonable (unless we are going to target embedded havingulimits on CPU use doesn\'t seem reasonable for real deployments).  Thecurrent behavior of dumping core and only having the message appear indmesg is highly undesirable."'

column10: b"b' This LGTM
column11: but before resolving the ticket you should also do a patch for mongos
column12: which has its own signal handler.'"

column10: b'b" OK
column11: I\'ll look into that too. On Thu
